Reviews.Title: “So cute!”
Reviews.Author: landlockedgm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a cottage. The motel is older, but it was clean and so quaint! We loved it. The water was nice and warm, pools were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Go see Annemarie”
Reviews.Author: Emily B
Reviews.Content: I have been taking an annual "renewal" trip to the mineral springs and mud baths of Calistoga for nearly 10 years. After trying a few of the spas in town, I continually return to Doc's. Not just because of their always reasonable rates and specials, but mainly because of Annemarie. She is the esthetician at Doc Wilkinson's. Her facials are truly amazing. She takes the time to analyze what would be best for you, every time. My spa time is incomplete without having an Annemarie facial. It always worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Tradition”
Reviews.Author: EHS_7
Reviews.Content: The ladies of the family have been visiting this resort for many years running...after our initial shock of visiting in the 70s as children when the facilities were quite more open! We love it here and the deals are always great when you call the office and ask, they will make sure you are getting the best deal. I had booked for one nights stay thinking I will just have time for the "healing waters" this time, but they mafde sure to remind me of the off season deal that included two muds for $5 more! Bless them! Love love love this place, embrace it's retro style and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Dominic L
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to relax and enjoy life at your pace Calistoga and Dr. Wilkinson's are a great choice. We spent two nights here while visiting family on vacation. The room was clean and functional. The hot tub was huge offering spacious soaking even while shared with other guests. The location is great within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. We ran into some of the staff while having drinks one night and they were very friendly and wanted to be sure we were having a good stay. This is a comfortable yet affordable place to stay while in wine country.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: MasterCamper
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Dr. Wilkinson's when I go to Calistoga. We have been coming here for more then 20 years and I can't wait to get back. We are of the kind which like to take off and go and where we end up is where we stay. Its an adventure to say the least. This is how we found Dr. Wilkinson's. I really didn't want to stay at a spa and the Calistoga Inn was full. Its haunted you know. Wilkinsons had a room for the right price and I had a bottle of Kornel champagne I wanted to drink so we decided to stay there. They have a Victorian home there that is also available. We had the chance to stay in it as an upgrade because we went at the time year when tourism was at a low. Very nice. What a suprise. Not only is the price right but the rooms are clean, very nice and comfortable. The staff is great and they won't bother you and you probably won't really notice them. They have the biggest mineral pool you have ever seen it is the size of swimming pool and the pool is inside. Just heaven. Calistoga is great getaway. Just down the road from Napa. The town is small and right out of the 30's and 40's lot of small restaurants and shops. California's Old Faithful Geyser is just up the street but the real star is the spa. Very, Very, Very relaxing. Mud baths and massages if you want to pamper yourself and I suggest you do. There are other spas up and down the street if you want to spend more money for a more modern facility. These spas have their pools outside for the most part you can see the steam rising from them when you drive bye. You will love Dr. Wilkinson's spa and the feeling of "home" you get here. Just the best. Hope this review was useful

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: JessN_18
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Poolside Bungalo this stay. It was wonderful! The kitchen area was clean and a great extra to have in our room. We were literally steps away from the pool. The warm mineral pool was incredible and relaxing. The room was in excellent shape and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was quiet and we weren't bothered at all. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “dr wilkerson hotel and spa”
Reviews.Author: captsin
Reviews.Content: stayed last week nice location clean rooms nice spa. did not do the mud bath but friends with us did. some raved about it others did not. resteraunts nearby good variety. wine tasting rooms within walking distance winerie nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A Calistoga Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldn't say enough positive things about this place! We have stayed there 2 summers in a row to celebrate our anniversary and both times we were upgraded. The place has a cool retro vibe, which we love. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and roomy. We have stayed on the second floor facing the courtyard and there isn't a view, but that hasn't bothered us. There is actually a wrap around balcony with chairs which is very nice to spend mornings on, and that has a great view of the main street, Lincoln Ave. (although it was under construction the summer of 2011). There are tables set up in various areas of the courtyard where I see people enjoying snacks, wine, and a good read. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I love the pools and especially the indoor hot tub. It is walking distance to all the main shops and restaurants, and close to our favorite winery, Schramsberg. We enjoyed a mud bath and massage, and both were excellent. For everything this place has to offer I think it's a steal! WE LOVE DR. WILKINSON'S!

Reviews.Title: “Old school is way cool!”
Reviews.Author: Carla S
Reviews.Content: Our original Calistoga happy birthday get-a-way plan did not include Dr Wilkenson's. It was quite by chance and an obnoxiously loud construction project that had us checking out of another property and searching for an alternate spa experience. The chance was meeting Mark - the proprietor - at a local bar. He and several other  locals made us feel right at home while watching the Sharks and Stanford. They all sang me happy birthday too!! After that fantastic birthday/bowl game/sharks win we awoke (at a different facility, mind you) to jack-hammers and chain saws and had to take a walk to save our ears and sanity.  Our sojourn took us to Dr W's as after a great evening we thought we would pay Mark a visit. We were greeted by Diane who let us know he would be in later and we started telling our story.  She (and later Mark) were truly sorry about our experience - these folks are first and foremost proud of their home town and hearing of our experience were hoping to help change our fortunes. She quickly explained their offerings - which were very reasonable and booked us for the mud bath, massage and night's stay pending our ability to cancel at the other property. No deposit, just our word that we would let her know ASAP.  An hour later cancelation in hand (for that story, check out my other reviews) we returned and were introduced to the pools and changing rooms to use while our room was readied - all this and it was just 10am!! At this point our expectations were seriously low - after jack-hammers anything would be more restful! Instead we met a Jacuzzi the size of a small swimming pool - Sign me up! The bath house is old school in the best sense of the term. It is not old (it is well maintained and clean!), it is not retro (upgrades are not cheesy 60's imitations but what would have been choosen had today's building technologies been available back then), it is like a true and fun time-warp! The friendliness and warm welcome we met the night before in the bar was enfused into the rest of our day. Step one to relaxing is being in a place that is truly relaxed. And that is what Dr W's was best at creating for us - a warm embrace ( which i later found is the perfect description of a mud bath!)  and invitation to relax.. And I for one think that is the perfect get-a-way. But know this is a bath house,not a frilly Burke spa day. This is communal (not public or private) space. It was just fine for our grandparents and we are happy to say for us too. But if you are uncomfortable being naked or seeing naked people in a shared space then you may not have the same experience. If you are open to something different in our rush rush modern world then give Dr W's a try. In short, it's fun, staff are amazing, beds are very comfortable and prices quite reasonable. We will no doubt be back. And with a great group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Good deal”
Reviews.Author: sewkap
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Wilkinson's for many years now. Over the years, we have tried a few others in Calistoga but return to Wilkinson's because it is so reliable -- and such a flashback to the 50's. we often stay in one of the duplexes with a kitchen, and, yes, we did get a great rate (as advertised here). The heated pool and huge spa alone make the stay worthwhile. Then there is the fact that you never need to move your car --- you can walk anywhere in Calistoga from doc Wilkinson's.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TravelerName
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dr. Wilkinson's because we were specifically looking for mineral pools and hot tubs (our first-choice property was under renovation so we had to find an alternative). At first impression, it had the original 1950's charm. It went downhill from there. We were given "an upgraded" and "remodeled" room. It was large, but barely furnished. There was no armchair for reading, just three regular desk chairs. The armoir for TV was gigantic, yet when we opened it we found a tiny little set, not flat-screen, maybe 20 inches. It looked so ridiculous that we had a good giggle over it. The faucet in the shower barely worked. The room had a narrow and claustrophobic shower stall, not a tub (an unpleasant surprise - we're staying at a mineral bath place and we'd like to soak in our own private bathroom). The carpets were drab. There was dust on top of the headboard. Everything in the room looked dingy. We specifically asked for a room away from the road, but no such luck - rattling cars and trucks kept us up at night (how about installing double-pane windows?). There were no amenities - no breakfast, no warm cookies in the evening, no cotton balls/q-tips/shower caps in the bathroom. The towels were thin, small, and scratchy. The pillows were springy and hard. Now, both of us like vintage and we find a lot of charm in old-fashioned, historic hotels (stayed at many). If you're going for the 1950's original look and feel, but all means, please do! Yet Wikinson's was simply cheap. The decor in the room didn't fit stylistically and was cheap. Everything about the place looked and felt like a Motel 6 rather than a high-end Calistoga spa that they claim to be. We paid an exorbitant price for this room (over $200 per night) and when we were checking out, I mentioned to the clerk how disappointed we were that nothing about the property was upscale like they claim. The clerk informed us that we had been given an upgraded room and overall their prices usually start at $250, so we got a good deal. Hmm... Traveling a month later, we had to spend an night at an airport Holiday Inn. It was incredible, in terms of the amenities it offered and the low price we paid. *THAT* was my beef with Wilkinson's - if I am paying over $200 a night, I am expecting to get value for my money. I would not have had a complaint if the room cost me $99, because that's all it's worth, taxes included.

Reviews.Title: “Always a treat and just plain enjoyable - love it.”
Reviews.Author: getupandgoNanaimo
Reviews.Content: The staff and therapy treatments are wonderful. It is a proper authentic type mudbath treatment centre. The owners/managers are very helpful.The rooms are well kept. Priced very well. I would like a microwave but that would mean major changes, which I believe they are starting on but then I may not be able to afford the rate SO GO AS SOON AS POSSIBLE! The atmosphere is great because all staff are happy. I would like to make this Resort a regular treat for us. I do love Calistoga too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AJ_5555
Reviews.Content: After a very long drive from Mammoth Lakes it was a relief to find Dr Wilkinsons. Especially as the first place we stopped was Yountville where in the tourist office I was dealt with by possibly the rudest person to work in the hospitality industry. So we carried on to Calistoga which was a great move. Far less stuffy than Yountville, Calistoga is a one-street town with some great places to eat and a laid back vibe. The motel is fine – big rooms, quiet, clean. There are 2 outdoor pools, one heated, which were very welcome, but be warned if you are an early bird, they aren’t open until 8am (no idea why) so if you want a swim first thing you’re out of luck. Didn’t try any of the spa services but if you want a functional motel in the heart of town this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and clean - in downtown Calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: lynnlynnTravel
Reviews.Content: e stayed here for 1 night during our long weekend in wine country. The location is great for downtown Calistoga - plenty of restaurants within walking distance. I think there were some shops too, but as we got in around 7:00pm and left at 9:00am we didn't really "look around". We had a king patio room and as noted in other reviews is decorated in sort of a 50's style. I would almost describe it as "quaint". The room itself was basic (as expected) but a very good size. Everything was neat and clean upon arrival and staff was very friendly and helpful at checkin. The bathroom was basic and clean, and it had a separate sink/vanity area. Amenties included: 2 bathrobes, soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and shower gel. We did not get to stay long enough to try out any of the "spa" or the pool. I would recommend this if you're looking for a basic, clean "nice" hotel in the calistoga area (I was almost wishing that we would've stayed another night or 2). The price - for a downtown Calistoga hotel - was great. And they were one of the few/any places around that didn't mandate a thurs - sunday stay in October.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but...”
Reviews.Author: ShootingGirl
Reviews.Content: I like to stay at small inns for the unique experiences. Dr. Wilkinson's gave us one! The staff is wonderful! The receptionist went out of her way to get us a quiet room. After about an hour, I knew the room was not going to be quiet enough for me (both the street traffic & the A/C unit). She gladly moved us to another in the back. It was blissfully quiet!!! We had good massages & mud bath. The hot tub was nice & hot (yes, I've been to some that have not been hot). Overall, the facility needs some sprucing up. The only downside was the bed. It was extremely uncomfortable, to the point that the last night I slept on the floor & slept better than the first 2 nights! No, I didn't complain. Guess I should have. We enjoyed our visit, but I'll have to think twice before booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Walk Back in Time to a Simpler Life”
Reviews.Author: TomV
Reviews.Content: I took my 87 year old Mother to Dr. Wilkinson's for a Mini Spa Vacation. We stayed Wednesday and Thursday Nights. The feeling of the Motel was back in the 40's when life was simpler. The room was clean and fresh. Was a little dated but did not lack on amenities. There is a mini Fridge to stock up with food or drink. Coffee maker and hair dryer. You also get the use of a Medium weight robe to wear to the pools or spa. The beds were very comfortable but the comforter was a little heavy in weight to sleep with. My only complaint about the room was the noise at night of the passing cars. We had the window open and didn't want to use the air conditioner (It wasn't really needed at this time of year). We had "The Works" at the spa. Very convent being next door. We booked the last appointments of the day. A MUST, you almost have the place to your self. The Mud bath was great -- neat feeling. Mineral Bathes were OK -- no big deal. Mini Steam room felt great. Blanket wrap was nice -- light weight blanket. Best part was the 1 hour Massage. Thanks John for a great Massage. I really liked it since he spent more time on my feet, legs, hands and arms and not so much on my Back. I felt very relaxed !! My Mother was like a limp rag (Good Thing) when we were done. Thank goodness we didn't have to walk to far to our room to collapse into our beds for a slumber sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay, exactly what we wanted and more”
Reviews.Author: debbie t
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in 5 star resorts and camped, and this clean, charming motel was exactly what we were looking for. Room was spacious, spa was good and a great deal. 3 temperature pools were perfect for our 4 yr old and us. Staff was super nice. Supermarket next door was very convenient for picking up picnic supplies and Peet's coffee. Right in town so we could walk to dinner but very quiet location. Everybody who worked in the motel and spa was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay very clean”
Reviews.Author: TaffsTours
Reviews.Content: Only had one night here on the napa leg of the road trip really enjoyed calistoga nice hotel te girl behind the desk was really nice and helpful Room was spotless my wife was a little sceptical as we are new to staying in motels but it was a good experience As always with motels try to stay on the top level !! It's less noisy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visiting Napa Valley and the very pretty Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: DeniseMortimer
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms,nice waffle bathrobes too! Staff friendly. Rooms clean and well presented, even if it;s all a bit dated. Good value for money. the 'works' treatment was ok- mud bath excellent and massage excellent but didn;t really need the mineral water bath or steam room. But made for a nice 1.5 hour indulgence.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: JessN_18
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time staying at Dr. Wilkinson's. My mom, sister, and I stayed for the weekend and did "the works" spa package. It was incredibly relaxing. My skin still feels incredible from the mud bath and mineral soak. There were many pools to try and the indoor hot tub was huge! The rooms were very clean and much larger than I expected them to be. I highly encourage anyone who wants a fun/relaxing vacation to stay at Wilkinson's. They are wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Neitch
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at Dr. wilkinsons! The pools were amazing, the indoor hot tub was wonderful! The service was excellent. My family and I did "the works" spa package. We all enjoyed our time in the spa. The mud bath was great followed by a wonderful massage. I would highly recommend staying at Dr. wilkinsons!

Reviews.Title: “We liked the WORKS/therapists, but the receptionist was rude!”
Reviews.Author: Jill_Berry
Reviews.Content: I just came back from an all girls' trip to SF/Napa area. At a suggestion from a family friend, we scheduled "the works" with a 2 hour appointment. The price was reasonable and the therapists were both great, but the receptionist was a bit rude. The receptionist was VERY irritable - I think she needs to have a daily spa to relax. The facility is a bit outdated and can use some R&R itself... Overall, other than the rude receptionist, it was a very nice mud bath/whirlpool, and massage experience for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing place, clean rooms and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nickiedee6
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely, relaxing stay at Dr Wilkinsons Resort- wow, how amazing! We arrived without a reservation and was given a room which, to be honest, exceeded our expectations. It was large, clean, modern and the bed was so comfortable! As we had never been to the area before, we asked the member of staff at reception how best to see the wineries in the area. She suggested by bike. What an experience! We packed a picnic (bought from the store next door) and off we went. I'd recommend this to anyone. The scenery was beautiful and we got to see all of the area in a day. We enjoyed our stay so much we decided to stay another night and visit the pool and the local restaurants. I'd recommend the inn at the end of the street. My partner loved their micro brewery! All in all, a wonderful place and a welcoming motel.

Reviews.Title: “the one and only”
Reviews.Author: nancylynn333
Reviews.Content: You have to stay here and do the 'works'. Consider it on your bucket list. Sweet staff , heavenly massage and the blanket wrap just melts me back into my mothers arms... Ahhh dig down into the mud, hotter and so delicious! Rooms are basic but by the time you slide out of the mud you just sleep like a baby. Almost everytime I go I see the old man sitting in the chair, smiling.Is he still with us? Or is it his ghost?

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: pshabod
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to some RR after a long stretch of work. The room was clean and the staff were polite. The nightmare started when a couple checked in above us and walked around all night long. The construction is VERY POOR and I was up all night listening to the people above and the next door guy's coughing. I mentioned this to the manager James, at checkout. He told me I should call him next time to get a better room! That is all. I honestly thought he would comp us or take something off the exorbitant $216 bill ( very high for a night at a poorly constructed motel), or some coupon for next visit. Instead he advised us to call him directly next time.

Reviews.Title: “A must if you are visiting the wine country”
Reviews.Author: info2share
Reviews.Content: This place had more character than any hotel I have been in EVER. It's just so funky! The sign out front is reminiscent of the old vegas sign. The room was twice the size of most hotel rooms - 2 queen sized beds and room for 2 more. Very clean with a fridge to keep your wine cold. No food, but there are restaurants up and down the street so you don't miss it. The spa is known for its mud baths. What an experience! one of the most interesting things I have ever done. Several pools of different temperatures all mineral water filled. The folks at the desk were helpful. The service at the spa was just ok - girl that took care of me must have assumed I had been there many times before and wasn't great at telling me what the process was so it was kind of like feeling my way through the dark, but hey, that was part of the funny. I recommend this place to everyone who tells me they are headed in that direction.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Old Charm”
Reviews.Author: Tyler P
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel, reasonably priced and walking distance to all of downtown. Rooms are old 1950 ish but updated with modern charm. Pools are nice with 3 different options of water temp. Romantic charm with spa available. My wife picked it and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Room and Wonderful Reception”
Reviews.Author: sakurasense
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Calistoga for less than 24 hours...a quick trip for a friend's wedding. We stayed in room 42 of the Victorian house. It was perfect to be able to book the room for one night, and the room was clean, roomy and very comfortable. - queen bed, sitting chair, in room coffee and refrig - everything we needed for our short stay. Unfortunately we did not have time to enjoy the mineral pools. The room price for one night was a bit high, but understandably it was a one night, Saturday night booking, during peak summer season in wine country and I cannot complain as the we requested to get in our room early to change for the wedding and the hotel gladly accommodated us - even on a weekend during peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Great: location, rooms, staff, price”
Reviews.Author: 2funsun1
Reviews.Content: Very nice all around. Went to Calistoga without any planning and stopped in. Staff person was really great getting us an inexpensive room (for Calistoga), telling us where to eat and what to do. Room was nice, and clean. The pool and hot pool were a great bonus. Right in middle of town for easy walking to restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of our Napa Valley holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: absunseeker
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for two nights and were very pleasantly surprised because I was a bit leery. Mixed reviews always make a person wonder just what you're going to get. We were going here anyway for "the works" and $40 more got us a room for the night so I decided to give it a try and I was assured that if I was not happy with the room, I was not obligated to stay a second night. Once we saw our room we knew that there was not going to be a problem at all. The rooms are a bit outdated but in kind of a cute, kitschy way (also very clean!) and the beds are super comfortable. The location right on main street is very convenient and the grocery store next door was handy for picking up breakfast and lunch items which we kept in the small refrigerator. We both thoroughly enjoyed 'the works' too and highly recommend it. There is a complete nudity element to it but we didn't feel uncomfortable and the attendants helped make you feel more comfortable too. It was a very relaxing experience and my daughter fell asleep while in her blanket wrap and had to be woken for her massage, lol. I personally had one of the best massages ever and I'm pretty sure it went for 40 mins and not just the 30 mins that I had booked, bonus!!! The warm swimming pool was fantastic and we enjoyed it every night along with the hot tub! Calistoga was our favorite part of our holiday and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Environment and Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: MesaW
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend with a friend for my birthday celebration. The staff were incredibly cheerful and eager to please. Our room was super clean with (my friend's comment) "the most comfortable, plush bed I have ever slept in while at a hotel...better than my own bed at home." We used both pools, which were nice and not crowded at all. The grounds were also clean and very serene. My only complaint is that a couple of staff started sweeping the courtyard area outside our room pretty early for a Sunday morning (8-ish). This was surprisingly loud and went on for a long time (guess that's why the place is so clean). My friend and I also enjoyed massages that morning. Mine was the best I've had in a long time and I'm quite picky because I used to do massage. The therapist was intuitive and checked in often to insure my comfort. All in all, a great value for a relaxing stay close to restaurants and shops. I'd certainly visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Thought It Would Be Better”
Reviews.Author: HighwayOneGirl
Reviews.Content: PROS: The room and facilities are very clean. The front-desk front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. The location is great--on the main street with shops and restaurants within walking distance. CONS: The indoor mineral pool had a heavy chlorine odor that filled the room which was not ventilated very well. The massage was very average. I asked for deep tissue and got a mediocre Swedish massage. My sister's massage was even worse--the touch was so light and slow that it was like a gentle caress, not a massage! My bath was too heavily scented with lavender (my sister thought hers was fine) that it was unpleasant. The blanket wrap was nothing more than a 7-minute rest on a vinyl-cushioned bed with a flannel sheet. The Works with Massage has a production-line feel to it, as if the girls are just trying to get the guests from one service to the next. OVERALL: It was relaxing. If your expectations are low to average, you won't be disappointed. I wasn't expecting a high-end spa experience, but I thought it would have at least felt like a really therapeutic treatment.

Reviews.Title: “If I could have taken a shower it would have been great!”
Reviews.Author: in222deep
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and the grounds and spa are nice, but when it came time to take a shower, the water would go real COLD and then BURNING HOT. They came to fix the shower, and they said it was fixed but it wasn't fixed. We all left on Sunday with NO shower. We told the girl in the front office and she said the room MAY need more maintance. I just left knowing I would never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay room was nice and comfy.. Spa was horrible”
Reviews.Author: tippertoes
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I had this planned for 2 months for a relaxing spa experience. We got none of the above. The spa mineral bathes were a joke I can buy one of those mats for my own tub. Steam room smelled very bad. The blanket wraps were a joke I was very cold and not the least bit relaxed. The message done by Mary was okay. But very bright lights no good smells lavender,Etc. Very noisy door bell ringing and noise all around not the least bit relaxing, money not well spent. The staff was very nice James and the Maid monique was a doll.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Relaxing Getaway Blocks from it All.”
Reviews.Author: jeffreyknapp1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a business trip to Napa and ended up staying at Dr. Wilkinson's on recommendations from a friend. This hotel has great value and prime location to downtown Calistoga. If you are looking for a quiet location that easily accesses the surrounding wineries, and restaurants, this is a perfect place for you. The website does not do it justice. The rooms are clean. The staff is super friendly. The pools are great. The beds are comfy. This is not a place with state-of-the-art flat screen TVs and designer bedding. If you are planning on spending lots of time in your room, watching TV, etc., this is not the place for you. However, if you are looking for a good spot to easily walk to everything in Calistoga, while being a short drive from some of the best wine country in the world, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, extremely clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: serve2me
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had the opportunity to spend 1-22-2011 and 1-23-2011 at Dr. Wilkinson's hotel. The hotel looks as thought it were lifted from the 1960's in Palm Springs. In fact, laying poolside with Palm trees swaying overhead, you would be hard pressed to not think you were in Palm Springs. The hotel is immaculate. I have traveled all over the world, and never seen such a clean hotel. The staff were very friendly. The indoor mineral pool / whirlpool, holds 38 people, although most times there were only a total of 4 people in it. The mud bath, mineral bath, and massage were great. Would we stay here again? You BET!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, clean, comfortable and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Lda49er
Reviews.Content: Made a quick trip to Calistoga the last week of December and stayed at Dr. Wilkinson's. The hotel was perfect. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The people are kind and go out of their way to make sure you have an enjoyable stay. The hotel is located walking distance from all the shops and nightlife Calistoga has to offer. My only regret is that I didn't have enough time to take advantage of the indoor pool or the spa, as I was only there for one evening. Looking forward to visiting again in the next few months with my family.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyautumn916
Reviews.Content: While the hotel customer service was 5 stars the spa was -1 they are rude and unwilling to take customers after 2:30 PM. I brought my daughter down for a celebration and thought this would be the perfect gift....what a waste of money and more importantly time! I'm very busy and wanted this weekend to be something to remember for all the RIGHT REASONS. Guess the customer service at the spa showed me wrong. My biggest regret is comming to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Callistoga under $500”
Reviews.Author: GSWelker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here and at the Solage, and oher places, on multiple trips to Callistoga. Solage is luxurious, but Dr. Wilkinson's is 90% as nice, without the rock-star pricetag. Let's face it, when you're taking a mudbath, do you really care if the wall is covered with silk or paint? I'd say the spa treatments at DW's are actually superior, the mudbaths are the best in tow by far, and the other facilities have a more relaxed and congenial atmosphere. Solage and most of the other spas watch the clock like hawks and rush you along ten minutes before you're done. I also greatly appreciate that they don't force you to pay for two nights on high-demand weekends! No wonder they've been aroudn for 60 years...great place at a fair price with a great attitude. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: ninac992
Reviews.Content: It was a rainy weekend and that wonderful big mineral bath with jets soothed my aching bones. The room was neat and clean, the location great and enjoyed all aspects of my stay. In the summer I stayed in one of the cabins and enjoyed an excellent and professional massage. The outdoor pool was great too, the cabins cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga and the other best kept secret in Napa valley”
Reviews.Author: persnicketysam
Reviews.Content: The pros: We have been coming to Calistoga annually for years because it is the most "real" of all of the Napa valley towns. Great restaurants, shopping and accomodations from the basic to the sublime. We recently returned from our latest stay there at Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs and Resort and I have to say, it has become one of our favorite places to stay in Calistoga. It's right in the middle of town with warm mineral water pools that beckon after a long journey. We went for one of their mud bath and massage options and afterwards felt like "buttah". The rooms are comfortable and clean, the beds were among the most comfortable ever and the whole place just feels right. You can spend more and you can spend less, but no other place has the charm and authentic Calistoga, Napa Valley feel like Dr. Wilkinson's. The cons: I can't think of anything that I could be critical of, o.k., maybe the pools should open early for those of us that want a nice soak at sunrise.

Reviews.Title: “Mud Baths & Mineral Pools in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: Scubapups
Reviews.Content: Calistoga is a great destination to stay when visiting Napa. It's less crowded & quieter than other trendier towns, such as Sonoma or Healdsburg. There are several great wineries within a close driving distance. And staying at Dr. Wilkinson's is a treat. It's not fancy, nor does it try to be. The value is excellent. The rooms could use some updating, they looked tired and outdated but clean, The best part about this hotel is after a day of wine tasting, you walk 2 blocks to a variety of decent restaurants, have dinner and then come back, put on a bathing suit and go soak in one of 3 mineral pools. I truly believe this is why we were never hungover the next day! I absolutely LOVED the outdoor hot mineral pool. It gets chilly in Northern California at night, but swimming & doing laps in this normal sized swimming pool underneath a starry sky was heaven. And we were there during harvest season (early October) yet had the mineral pools to ourselves! Even my husband swears his skin became softer after 3 nights of mineral pool swims. We did the mud bath treatment and really enjoyed the weightlessness of the peat infused volcanic ash warm mud. The lavender scented whirlpool bath was very relaxing, then were put in a steam room (men & women are segragated here, you're naked, except for the little towel you wear in the steam room). The iced towel and lemon water helped rehydrate, then off to a massage included in the package. I was very happy. It took most of the morning so we didn't go wine tasting until that afternoon, which I didn't mind because it was a nice treatment. It's not fancy, it's not like a regular new age music playing spa. But that's ok. Calistoga is kind of a laid back, old-fashioned town so it all just fits in. I usually don't like to do repeat visits but this is a place I would like to go back to. Hope they do consider some small cosmetic changes to rooms (replace carpet & redo the bathrooms), but other than that. it was great. And the BEST VALUE you'll find in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Spa-rkling Little Place”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Hants
Reviews.Content: We were in Napa at the tourist info and deciding where to go. The very helpful staff suggested this place if we fancied going to Calistoga and also got us a reduced rate for the night. We were pleasantly surprised both we Calistoga and Dr Wilkinson's. We only had a night here but the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable and the choice of three spa pools (with one inside) was great. We didn't have any treatments but the steady flow of clients booked in was a sure sign that this was a good place to go if that's what you are after. If we venture back this way we'd be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kill the ticking clock!”
Reviews.Author: urbanite1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Dr Wilkinson's. We had a very nice room, enjoyed the pools, and got The Works. Our cool-down and massage were ruined by a loudly ticking clock (in the women's area). How I wish the new age massage music would have drowned it out. This is a simple fix - I was told there had been other complaints. I would not purchase any spa treatments at this establishment until I was assured that someone had taken this seriously. This was a splurge for us and it was really marred.

Reviews.Title: “a trip back in time . . .”
Reviews.Author: Austinbe
Reviews.Content: this place takes you back to the mud baths of days past . . . the motel itself was clean and functional . . . the staff was incredibly freiendly and helpful . . . and the spa was an absolute blast. Great value! Totally relaxing! Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “A great value place to stay in a great town”
Reviews.Author: JulieD36
Reviews.Content: We had another great stay at Dr Wilkinsons. It is the second time we stayed and we really like the hotel/motel and the town. I love the spa treatments - Dr Wilkinson's The Works but my husband hates it and I guess it is a bit hardcore. Can't fault this place at all. Immaculately clean, free wifi, a fridge, great toiletries, coffee, bathrobes all at a really affordable price. During our recent trip to California we stayed at a whole range of hotels from motels to the Intercontinental in Monterrey and absolutely the best value for money is Dr Wilkinsons. Add in the town with the range of restaurants then I really can't think of a better place to stay - far outshines St Helena in my book.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jerrego
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Victorian House.....clean, homey,good friendly service.we enjoyed the hot mineral jacuzzi pool (free). We were greeted by Mark Wilkenson who made us feel very welcome. We walked to town and found good restaurants very close by. Fun funky golf course in Calistoga,

Reviews.Title: “The Works is the Bomb”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: I thouroughly enjoyed my first (and I hope not last) treatment at Dr. Wilkinson's. The mud bath intrigued me, so I signed up for "the works," - mud bath, mineral whirlpool, steam room, wrapped rest and massage. The entire experience was excellent. Staff made me feel welcome and comfortable throughout. The massage was wonderfully deep, but did not leave me sore. I left feeling all aglow and invigorated. I highly recommend this place with the caveat that prospective clients read about the process on the resort's Website and read negative as well as positive reviews to determine if this is the right place for you. Anyone looking for a frou-frou spa or who would be uncomfortable with nudity or with, well, mud, should look elswhere. If you want an authentic and professional spa treatment in the old-world sense, get thee to Dr. Wilkinson's. Treatments are fairly priced and represent good value, i.e. an hour massage is 60, not 50 minutes, as has become standard at many spas.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise in a great little town”
Reviews.Author: Hwal
Reviews.Content: During a 2 week trip to california with my wife, we headed to calistoga to escape a chilly SanFran and were fortunate to end up in this great little Motel. We hadn't booked accommodation and thought to stay in a B&B for a night in Calistoga. But the B&Bs were dearer than this motel and we booked in. What a great decision. Rooms were much nicer that we expected - large, clean and well decorated and equiped. Real highlights of this motel was the pools - it has 3 mineral pools of different temps - from warm to hot bath - 2 outside and one indoors. We liked the motel and calistoga so much we stayed another night. No breakfast but free parking and a short walk to the main street and it's shops & diners. Word on Calistoga - great "small town america" location and I say that with the utmost respect. Nice people, good food and lovely little town - it even had a county fair on while we were there - must be a great place to live.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Relaxing Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: melann56Capitola
Reviews.Content: Just back in from a great trip to Dr. Wilkinson's. I 've been a frequent flyer there for years and no matter what season you go, it's always a treat. The staff is friendly, with exceptional spa treatments-mudbaths and massages.. Need I say more? Also, the Victorian rooms are quiet- and beautiful -to stay in. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great pools.”
Reviews.Author: spaqueen2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic, refurbished motel. The location is really great just steps from a wonderful supermarket with lots of organic offerings. It was difficult to sleep at night because of the light in the hallway. Rooms with 2 queens are cramped. I had breakfast at Sarfornia it was decent. We had BBQ at the BBQ place on the junction it was good but too much sugar in the coleslaw and the sauces. Next time I am trying Jole, Solage and Calistoga Inn . Make sure to stop at Bouchon Bakery in Yountville for fabulous pastries. I love the Model Bakery on Main St. in St. Helena for lunch, great salads, seasonal pizza, sandwiches and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Dearly loved my mud bath, massage and special attention!”
Reviews.Author: jobiej
Reviews.Content: This being my second trip to Doc's, I was dearly looking forward to another warm, soothing feeling while lying in a mud bath - it did not disappoint. It's delightful wiggling one's toes, fingers, the cooling sensation of cucumber slices on the eyelids and in general, ideal contentment. Next was a whirlpool bath followed by relaxing, while lying prone, snuggled in a thick, terry robe. A steam bath was next, followed by a deep-tissue massage, (one can choose the type of massage). The kindliness extended by the staff is exceptional. Having friends in the area, I did not stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!!!!”
Reviews.Author: noosee
Reviews.Content: Again I visited Dr. Wilkinsons, in the lovely city of Calistoga,as I have been doing since 1962. The owners Caroline Mark and Howard, and their,very kind and well trained personel ,always make me feel like part of the family.I very much enjoy the outdoor, warm swimming pool which can be used all the year and their indoor hot pool soothes the pains I sometimes have in my shoulders and hips,and if that does not help then their very well trained massage technicians do the rest. If one wants more country style quarters one can also stay at thewir lovely HIDEAWAY Resort, lovely cabins, with kitchens and only two blocks from downtown.,Spread out on 2 ackers of land, with large swimming pool and again a very hot Jaccuzi pool one gets the feeling of beeing way out in the country. Lovely, lovely lovely

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: ron1607
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at "Doc's". Great room, wonderful pools, and a really nice staff. My brother and I enjoyed the mud baths and I really relaxed and appreciated the massage, which was a first for me. I left feeeling really mellow and relaxed! Tim, my massage therapist was great and gave me some tips for relaxation. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. The front desk recommended a small winery (Tudal) and they gave a great tour! In all, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quality & Comfort!!”
Reviews.Author: songbird1962
Reviews.Content: I have been using this facility since 2007 and have never been disappointed. The staff is very attentive to your needs and very knowledgeable of the facilities and all that it has to offer. The spa services are wonderful and I recommend the following: facials, mineral baths and massages (1 hr). The masseuses are respectful, courteous, knowledgeable and professional. I enjoy the separate dressing rooms for men and women and the staff is very cognizant of the intimate nature of what the business and i feel very relaxed and comfortable while in their care. The pools (x3) are magnificent. They offer two (2) outdoor heated pools and the largest and most spectacular 'in-door hot tub" that I've ever seen. This hot tub can easily accommodate 20 - 25 people confortably. ( You have to see it to believe it!! Since it is enclosed, you can use this pool year round.... no matter the outside weather conditions (rain or shine). The location is perfect, since it is on the main drag (Lincoln Avenue) so you can walk to various shops, restaurants and the grocery store. So, if you're looking a for a place to swin, relax, spa or do absolutely nothing, this is the place. They also have a courtyard where you can sit at night where the weather is nice and enjoy eating your food with a nice bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “WILKINSON'S WENT OUT OF THEIR WAY to provide GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: tonebobb
Reviews.Content: On the drive to Dr. Wilkinson's in Calistoga, I got very, very sick. Not car-sick... food poisoning sick. Horrible. We had four reservations for "The Works" - mud bath, herbal bath, massage, etc. When we arrived, my friends informed the folks at Dr. Wilkinson's that I was ill, and the staff went way out of their way to take care of me and make me feel comfortable. They canceled my appointment, gave me a place to lie down, covered me with blankets, brought water, and checked on me regularly (and quietly) throughout our time there. My friends each got "the best massage I've ever had," and I was incredibly well cared for. Fortunately, this was not my first visit to Dr. Wilkinson's. But unfortunately, since I'd been there before, I knew what I was missing.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute dump.”
Reviews.Author: haightgirl
Reviews.Content: We are Calistoga regulars who come every few months, and we usually stay at Indian Springs, where the lodge rooms are perfect (Frette linens, flatscreen TV, welcomed with a bottle of wine and a brand new beautiful bathroom, for $185 winter midweek) and we dream constantly about their geyser-fed, heated, outdoor olympic sized fantastic pool.They were all booked for the President's Day weekend so we settled for a double queen, patio room at Dr. Wilkinson's ($189) and did treatments and day pool passes at Indian Springs. I thought -- how bad could Dr. Wilkinson's be? The TripAdvisor reviews were good. Answer: Pretty bad. I think the folks who think Dr. Wilkinson's is wonderful just haven't been anywhere else. Let me first say that I adore midcentury modern. A place like this could have been remodeled to look smashing. Its clean lines provide excellent bones. I get the whole simple, natural, anti-bougie spa thing. This ISN'T IT. But honestly, this place is a DUMP. It looks like a decaying dump of a motor hotel. We stayed in a room that looked like it hadn't been redone since 1973. The musty smell hit us as soon as we entered the room and we spent our entire time there with the window open. We wished we had brought a candle to burn. Flowery, old, matted and smelly rust-brown flowery carpet. Cinderblock walls. Old, smelly curtains. A bathroom from 1963. Blue flowered wallpaper. I had a headache just from the decor, torn straight out of a 1976 suburban romper room. Tiny TV. We went to dinner and told ourselves we could at least relax at the pools, which were a quarter of the size of Indian Springs and had no floating devices as they do. Sadly, a child was allowed to bring a glass bottle to the pool area. It broke, a few pieces went into the pool, and they closed the pool only 5 minutes after we got in. We then spent 15 minutes in their indoor mineral pool -- heated to a high jacuzzi temp so that you can only safely be in there for 15 minutes before you pass out. Mind you, we LOVE the Indian Springs perfectly heated pool (just hot enough to feel delicious when the air is cool), which is open until midnight. We usually spend HOURS there, just floating. We thought we could do that at Wilkinsons. Instead, we spent 15 minutes in the hot, indoor pool crowded with four other couples, then just went back to our room, completely disheartened. The romance was all gone as we willed ourselves to sleep on the mushy mattresses in that smelly room, mumbling "God, what a dump." My husband woke up with back pain from the horrible mattress. On top of it all, there was no parking for us. The hotel lot was completely full so we had to park on the deserted street in front of the hotel. My husband was absolutely incredulous that we paid $200 for a place that we wouldn't pay $30 for if we found it off of a freeway in a random small town. We didn't even take pictures as we would be embarrassed to show them to friends and admit how much we paid. Don't do it. Do Indian Springs, or anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Dr. Wilkinsons is the best!”
Reviews.Author: tjks
Reviews.Content: My husband I have have been going to Dr Wilkinsons for 25 years now. The rooms and grounds are always immaculately clean, the hot tub and two pools very clean and very relaxing. All of the treatments in the spa have been wonderful, and we always feel nurtured and well taken care of. You have to try the mud bath if you haven't experienced it before! Couldn't recommend more highly. :) Tamara

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Calistoga...”
Reviews.Author: demodiva
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Dr Wilkinsons Hideaway Cottages in October. There were 6 friends traveling together for a weekend in wine country but we were having a hard time finding B&B's or hotels to accomodate all of us for 2 nights during the peak of the season. I read some great reviews on TripAdvisor on the Hideaway cottages and decide to give it try. We rented 2 side by side 1 bedroom cottages. Both cottages were 1 bedrooms with small kitchen and living room areas. We had the bedrooms set up with 2 twins in each and then there was a pull out in the living room. The cottages are small and nothing luxurious but they were both extremely clean, very quiet and they are in a great location, walking distance to downtown Calistoga yet tucked away on a quiet sidestreet. And we were there primarily for wine tasting and restuarants and not the hotel/spa/resort experience so this was perfect. Free parking was available as well. The complimentary breakfast each morning was AMAZING, fresh fruit, oatmeal, muffins and scones with jams, coffee makers in the cottages. We had a very comfortable stay in the Hideaway Cottages!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Volcano09
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I stayed here for one night before Thanksgiving. Our room was on the second floor and very clean, quiet, cozy and inviting. We liked the individually wrapped jellie bellies in the room. The staff was wonderful--our check in went smoothly and we LOVED our mud baths and massages. It was just great. We felt pampered and totally relaxed afterward. If you're expecting a very luxurious spa, this isn't it but for us it was all we hoped for. Marsha, who took care of our mud and mineral baths was just great, she was caring, efficient and personable. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Listen, you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: kmbyopie
Reviews.Content: The Ritz it is not. But, they are not trying to be the Ritz either. Clean, comfortable rooms, great pools and a fantastic location. It has been there forever and is still the spot for a mudbath. I read reviews before and after my trip and I am always amazed what some people are expecting. If you are going to pay between $100-$200, don't expect to stay at a place that has the same amenities of a place that charges $500-$1000. It's like going to Denny's, ordering a steak and getting upset that it is not as good as the steak you had at Morton's. The two are not the same. They are both good in their own ways but don't compare them. My room was in the Victorian House which my wife would have loved but I did not mind. The bed was comfortable, the water was hot, the TV and AC worked and I felt like the room was very clean. Parking was free and plentiful and the desk staff answered all my questions. It is what it is. It is not what it isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Worst spa in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: SmilesTennessee
Reviews.Content: The mud bath's are under very bright lights and in a loud non-private room. The whirlpool baths are small bath tubs with an air hose stuck between your feet and not private. The cool down beds and massage beds are not private either just a curtain between you and everyone so you hear all the talking and it's hard to relax. This place is so old school it feels more like a boxing gym locker room or some kind of 50's men's club. Golden Haven, Lavender Hill are much more peaceful and worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Relaxing Mineral Pool Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: kasong
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a Classic King room for our anniversary in November and we are completely satisfied with the experience. The accommodations, facilities, and staff were as good as it gets. The bed even had pillow-top padding that made us just sink into sleep. My only regret was that we didn't have enough time for the mud baths. The room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The heated mineral pools are wonderful at night with the contrasting cool winter air. In fact, we had the pools to ourselves on a Thursday night just after it had rained. I would especially recommend Dr. Wilkinson's for a winter getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Spa.....Comfortable and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: SeattleAnneSeattle
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this wonderful spa in a newly decorated/remodeled king room. We treated ourselves to relaxing massages....highly recommended!! We enjoyed soaking in the huge indoor mineral pool on the cool fall nights and slept like babies in the ultra plush king bed. Quiet and relaxing.....We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently maintained to result in a relaxing superior experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mudbath100
Reviews.Content: Our family for 3 generations has visited Dr. Wilkinson's in Calistoga. Why? This family owned business is consistent in its management when it comes to a warm welcome, superb clean and comfortable facilities and reasonable pricing. When ever we visit...we can expect the same quality of service at all times. I don't know of another spa that has 3 different types of relaxing pools..indoor and out. I highly recommend this Calistoga treasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value upmarket motel in pricey area with excellent spa treatments”
Reviews.Author: Muddyfunster
Reviews.Content: Calistoga is a cozy and romantic upmarket Western style town and Dr Wilkinson's is superbly situated near the centre of the town with access to some really good bars and restaurants. We arrived and were upgraded which is always nice. The beds in the rooms were huge and very comfy and although the decor of the rooms is understated this is an upmarket motel which offers great value. Free parking is available at the side of the motel and is only a few steps away from rooms. Only negative is that we were in a ground floor room and the noise from the people above was very loud (everytime they walked around in their room). We tried all the treatments and it was great value at $169 as it lasted over 2.5 hours. Mud baths are very good, as is the massage. Be warned though, if you are male, the massage will be done by a guy, which was a little unexpected. Having said that it was better than most massages I have had by women as it was much stronger and firmer. Felt totally energized after. I can definitely recommend this motel to anyone visiting Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “We've been coming to Dr. Wilkinson's for 30 years and plan to for 30 more!”
Reviews.Author: JMc1001
Reviews.Content: Three generations of our family have been making a trip to Calistoga at least twice a year. We have strayed and stayed at the other spas on the strip and never do they compare to Dr. Wilkison's. We find the service at Dr. Wilkison's to be the most accommodating, friendly and professional. This quaint, unpretentious retro hotel is conveniently located at the far end of Calistoga's main street, the perfect distance for an afternoon stroll or to walk off a fabulous dinner. The rooms are immaculate, simple and so comfortable. The beds and the linens are heavenly and I melt into them after an evening dip in the hot indoor mineral whirlpool (my daughter loves the heated outdoor mineral pool.), but the spa is the best experience and really why we come. My mom suffers from sciatica and I have a pesky rotator cuff. Nothing works better to relieve stress and detox city life than a mud bath. I always get "the works" with a 1 hour massage. I request my favorite massuer, Reynaldo, and I hate for the session to end. The mud is magical and so is the talent running the show. Dr. Wilinson's knows hospitality and they have the experience and knowledge that insures we are satisfied every time. We recommend this place above the rest to all our friends. I can't wait for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Completely unappealing - simply appalled at price/value ratio”
Reviews.Author: LotofTravel
Reviews.Content: I'm reading the other reviews and I simply can't believe what I'm reading. My husband and I travel quite a bit and we've been all over and I was appalled at the condition of this property. This is absolutely not a property that is worth $255 per night plus tax. I think it's shameful. I assumed because it was in the wine country, there are enough people that get there and are sort of stuck, that they just don't go back. But then reading these reviews, I guess I'm wrong. The property looks like a Motel 6 from the 1950's - made out of tinder blocks, concrete everywhere, plastic cups and plastic ice bucket in bathroom, lamp fixtures looked like they came from Target, single paned windows - you could hear the traffic, draperies unlined and only barely cover window (not to floor), towels paper thin, iinsulation from rooms is non existent (you could literally hear the person above us peeing in the toilet), plastic corian counter top, laying in bed you could see the plumbing from the sink, the TV in the armoire was so small- it was actually a little difficult to see picture very well when lying in bed, we were told it had WIFI - sure, but you have to go OUTSIDE the room to get a signal (because of the concrete construction) - I could go on and on. I was born and raised in Napa Valley and I'm embarrassed for this place. It's been there a long time, I know that. But when we were told it had been redone and upgraded, I believed then. When we booked the room (which was very last minute) they were the only rooms available in town - that should have been my first clue. It's just not a $255 room, it's a motel/hotel room that is not worth more than $175 - maximum. It was clean, no question about that. And the bed was very comfortable. But if you want quaint, romantic, interesting, this is not the place. The town is lovely and we walked around and saw several other places to stay that were definitely in the same price range that were worth the money. This place is a completely rip off.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing week-end ever!”
Reviews.Author: MAMSoCal
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the most relaxing week-end ever! Dr. Wilkingson's is a taste of the original spa experience in the picturesque town of Calistoga. The staff was absolutely accommodating and met our every need. The location is perfect, within easy walking distance to wonderful shops and restaurants. Calistoga is not pretentious like some other Napa towns; it is pure charm. "The Works" is the way to go at the spa. The hot water pool is totally relaxing and guarantees a great night's sleep. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful visit to the Doctor's.”
Reviews.Author: PAMM1
Reviews.Content: I just cannot say enough about Dr. Wilkinson's. What a wonder place to say. We enjoyed the pools, and the treatments. The massage is to "die for". The staff is so attentive and professional. Not to mention the cleanliness of the hotel. We stay at Dr. Wilkinson's at least once a year if not more. I cannot wait to go back what a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “R&R at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Muelleac
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th trip to Dr. Wilkinson's - the laid back atmosphere and friendly staff keep us coming back. Rooms are not fancy, but comfortable and very clean. The warm swimming pool is great, perfect temperature - most hotel pools are way too cold. We did all the spa treatments, except for facials this time - but I will definitely schedule a facial next time because their esthetician is great. Perfect quiet place to recharge your batteries, without any irritating frou frou!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for wine country and relaxation fun!”
Reviews.Author: calisoccer12
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a girl's weekend getaway. The location was perfect for being able to go wine tasting in both Napa and Sonoma county. We went wine tasting in the morning then came back to relax poolside at Dr Wilkinson's in the afternoon. The 3 different temperature pools were great to choose from, we usually chose the coolest pool because it was hot in July! There are two cute courtyards that were a nice place to eat breakfast. There is a grocery store right next door that had yummy pastries and good coffee. At night there are a bunch of great restaurants within walking distance which is a major plus! Calistoga is such a cute and charming town! I recommend Checkers for some great pizzas and Cafe Sarafornia if you want a big breakfast. Calistoga Inn was a fun place for drinks and some dancing. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean and the beds were comfy. The shower was a little small but not a big deal. Before we checked out on Sunday our whole group got awesome massages at the spa. The masseuses were all very professional and seemed well trained. It was the perfect way to end our weekend. We were so sad to leave but will definitely be coming back to visit more wineries!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dr. Wilkinson's, great rooms, pools, and spa treatements!”
Reviews.Author: lovaloha
Reviews.Content: Dr. Wilkinson's was a great place to stay! Rooms have been recently renovated. There are 3 different mineral pools with temperatures ranging from cool and refreshing to hot and relaxing. Next door is the grocery store offering a great selection of cheese, sandwiches, and great coffee! Calistoga offers a wide range of restuarants and shops all in walking distance. Spa treatments are affordable and staff and therapists were all very friendly. I would highly recommend this for couples, friends, or families!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and dingy motel with a discourteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: Libby_NY
Reviews.Content: The staff was discourteous, the motel lobby and rooms were dirty. I know we saved on the price, but next time we will splurge a bit more for a clean experience where the staff is professional. Calistoga is a cute town, but I recommend stay somewhere else like the Calistoga Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Best massage of my life and the real deal for a Calistoga mud bath.”
Reviews.Author: MellowMe
Reviews.Content: Times are a little tight, but my wife and I were ready for a "staycation," and needed to let go of some stress, so we went for an overnight at Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs. We've been to Calistoga over the years, and Dr. Wilkinson's is an institution in this lovely and quiet wine country town. What I didn't expect this time, and what earned my five stars, is I had the very best massage of my life (ask for Renaldo if you want to turn into a limp noodle)! The massage was part of what they call "The Works," which is a mineral "mud bath" that's actually sterilized peat and volcanic ash, a mineral and steam bath and massage all together. When it was all done, I thought I would melt through the floor. This is a family owned business, so their attention to quality and the training of their staff has been consistent over the years. You don't get a "corporate" feel. Instead, they've got a vintage Buick parked outside with the license plate, "Mud King", Dr. Wilkinson's trademark until he passed away a few years ago. We're told the sign also dates back to the 1950s. We were fortunate to stay in the Hideaway Cottages owned by the same establishment. This is a group of cottages on spacious grounds with mature plantings located a couple of blocks off the main drag, so it's extra quiet. It's got a pool, a Jacuzzi, and some picnic tables under some shady trees. The kitchenette in our cottage shows the quaint decor of the '50s, but the essential features have been updated and well maintained, and the king size bed was very comfortable. There was a separate room for reading and TV, although we were more interested in going out on the town. They also offer a European breakfast of tasty muffins, fruit, fresh ground coffee and juice, and there's a fridge and stove if you really don't want to enjoy the great restaurants that abound in the wine country. The staff at Wilkinson's will give you coupons for many local establishments if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Lucyii1
Reviews.Content: From your staff to your rooms, we had the most incredible stay ever! We are planning on going back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: wurldtruvler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in Calistoga. What a fun time - Dr. Wilkinson's was a perfect place to stay. We loved being able to walk to the restaurants and walk thru town in the evening. Had an amazing meal at a small restaurant they recommended called BarVino - loved it! Treated ourselves to The Works at the Spa and it was so relaxing. Great Massage, great big bathtubs to soak in and it was very clean! We highly recommend Dr. Wilkinson's and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “dr. wilkinson's”
Reviews.Author: sousak
Reviews.Content: I had a terrrific massage at Dr. Wilkinson's in calistoga. Everyhone there was so pleasant and professional. My massage was terrrific, thanks Alex! It was very soothing and the atmosphere was serene perfect setting for an afternon of relaxation. i am booking my next massage for July, can't wait. thanks again, kristy

Reviews.Title: “Massage”
Reviews.Author: MarciLynn
Reviews.Content: I recently had a massage at Dr. Wilkinson's and let me say it was wonderful! Not only was the Massage Therapist very skilled but the Spa staff was extremely professional and the facility was very clean. This was my first time getting a Hot Stone Massage and it definitely won't be my last. I will certainly bring Dr. Wilkinson's my future business, as I had a truly enjoyable experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best”
Reviews.Author: OCLover
Reviews.Content: 50's throw back motel that is nothing special. Female desk clerk was unfriendly and discourteous.

Reviews.Title: “Dr Wilkinson's Resort: Don't leave anything behind - you may never get it back!”
Reviews.Author: CntryAgain
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the resort and while the room was nice, and the spa was nice and the mineral pool indoors was wonderful, their followup service lacked sincerity. I accidentally left a watch and a pair of glasses in my room when I checked out. When I reached my next destination, I called the resort to see if they had been found. Housekeeping had found the items and once I identified them I was told they would be sent FedEx to my home. It has been 3 weeks and I have made numerous calls to the resort. They keep telling me mey items were sent, but cannot produce a tracking number or any information to substantiate this claim. IF you go for the spa BE SURE you do not leave anything behind or you may NEVER see it again!

Reviews.Title: “For Awesome De-Stressing, Try "The Works" at Dr. Wilkinson's Hot Springs”
Reviews.Author: fun4jg
Reviews.Content: During a recent stay at the Hideaway Cottages, I did “the works” at the nearby Dr. Wilkinson’s Hot Springs (managed by the same owners) in Calistoga. This is the signature treatment at this iconic establishment, which is one of Calistoga’s original mud bath spas. “The Works” is the perfect way to de-stress weary bodies and overtaxed minds. It includes a mud bath, aromatic mineral whirlpool bath, steam room, blanket wrap, and massage. In two and a half hours, I was transformed into a limp noodle. From the moment my body sank into the warm, soft mud, I began to feel my tension ease. As my body soaked up the healing powers of the volcanic ash and peat, I was pampered with a facial mask and eye cucumber peel. Then, showering off the residual mud was like washing my stress down the drain. The next delights − mineral bath, steam room, and cozy blanket wrap − carried me deeper into an increasingly relaxed state. And the grand finale − my one-hour massage − was delivered by expert hands that had just the right healing touch. I drifted into dream land. When it was time to leave the table, I softly awakened and floated off to the shower. The bath house staff that administered “The Works” expertly attended to every detail − the temperature of the showers, mud and mineral baths; the blankets, towels, and robe; the quiet atmosphere; the soothing music. They gently and unobtrusively guided me through each step of the process. I felt utterly pampered. All of this came at a reasonable price. I urge you to try “The Works.” But, be warned: You just might get addicted to it! (By the way, I'm quite familiar with the entire Dr. Wilkinson's property, which is excellent. See my ratings.)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, simple, very clean spot for relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: WhiteSoxGal
Reviews.Content: I read about this place in a previous issue of the Southwest magazine and eagerly planned a trip to stay here with my sister. It is an easy drive to Calistoga from San Fransisco, and since this town is on the northern end of Napa Valley, it is not as conjested. We did not see a tour bus the whole time! We arrived early -around 10 am, and our room was not ready. The original desk clerk was very helpful and gave us tips for our day of wine tasting/touring. However, upon our check in later in the day, the young man who checked us in was not helpful at all. He did not even tell us which way to go to get to our room, what amenities were available, or when check out was! Strange. Anyway, the three pools were amazing and very, very clean and quiet. We loved the heated indoor pool---fabulous! Our room was very clean and simple with a refrigerator (very nice touch). We both had massages and were very pleased with the service! Not brave enough to try the mud bathes this time! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “In need of major renovations”
Reviews.Author: trvl2lv
Reviews.Content: This place is an old motel, probably dating back to the 1960's if not earlier. The rooms are spacious and were partially renovated - newer beds, very old analog TV, old furniture, new wall decoration. The bathroom has a linoleum floor with a rusted shower stall, no tub. The sink area is formica - probably the original stuff. Cigarette butts all over the public areas, including in front of my room. The spa looks old and uninviting and is in need of a MAJOR renovation, like the rest of the place. Avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Six months of relaxation packed into each hour of mud & massage”
Reviews.Author: LAandEE
Reviews.Content: I first visited Dr. Wilkinson's almost 20 years ago ... got busy with work and family and forgot about me ... that won't happen again! I was glad they had not turned into some fancy spa for only the rich and beautiful. Everything was very easy, staff was great. The Wilkinson family has kept up the Dr.'s commitment to the experience being healthful... even the linens were hypoallergenic. Wish I could get a prescription from my health insurance for the next trip this summer!

Reviews.Title: “We are relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: DavisMolly
Reviews.Content: OUr women's group has been coming to Calistoga for over 10 years and we always stay at Doc Wilkinson's. It is so central to everythng Calistoga and a wonderful way to get relaxed and sort out all our cares. We spa, relax, eat, talk and massage some more. The facials and one-hour massages are heavenly! Each year we leave and can hardly wait for the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxation place centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: mltravelor
Reviews.Content: I and a group of friends have made an annual trip to Calistoga for about 15 years. We always stay at Dr. Wilkerson's because we like the accommodations, the spa treatments and the proximity to great restaurants and shopping. We use the beautifully landscaped patios as gathering and picnic places with food and wine from the high end grocery store across the street. A first night soak in the indoor hot pool spa after a dinner downtown is a cherished tradition. Our second day is occupied with facials, mud baths, massages and shopping, followed by a picnic dinner on the patio near our rooms. One of the helpful and cheerful staff members lit the patio heaters for us and returned after dinner to turn them off on our last visit. When he was alive, Dr. Wilkerson would often stop by to welcome us; now it is his son Mark who does the honors. We return to our "real lives" relaxed and refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality, Cleanliness, Location, and Get Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: arahoeitak
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Dr Wilkinsons for a day and night of relaxation...and boy did we get it. From the front desk staff welcoming us and showing the grounds, to the wonderful housekeeping staff being attentive and making our stay most enjoyable. We stayed in the Victorian house....which i highly recommend. The rooms were bright and extremely clean. The beds comfortable and the heat was self- regulated in the bedrooms. There is an on-site spa with mud baths, mineral pools, facials, massages, and much more. The prices are very reasonable and services are top notch. During out stay we followed the suggestions of the front desk staff. The location is dead in the center of calistoga. Many restraunts, shops, and bouiques were within 1-2 blocks away. St Helena and Napa are just a short 5-10 minute drive down the street, but there is so much to enjoy in Calistoga as well. I highly reccommend Dr Wilkinsons and can't wait to go back. Mabey we will get nicer weather, but even with the rain over the past few days the mountains and steaming hot springs were gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great relaxation”
Reviews.Author: aanderson3
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about having a mudbath at first but the staff was wonderful and helped make the experience one that i will never forget. My friends and i came to Calistoga for the wine but now know that there is much more to offer. This was my first trip to the napa valley but i felt like i was staying with an old friend. The front desk staff was eager to help me with dinner reservations and places to visit for the nightlife. I must say that Calistoga is a small town, but it has many great options to chose from for late night drinks. When you visit it is a must that you try the works; it really is a relaxing day at the spa. I cannot wait to return and experience this again!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Crockett_ca_Judybug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming here for years and wouldnt think of staying anywhere else.My daughter Linda brought me here this weekend and it was Great,it was her first time and shes already planning another trip.This was a Birthday present from her and we had the works and it was fabulous,the staff is great. the pools are great .love this place Judy

Reviews.Title: “Loved the MudBath!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boston02122
Reviews.Content: We have just developed our photos from our trip to California and one of the most memorable photos is that which my girlfriend and I are soaking in the mudbaths, heads wrapped in towels with cucumbers on our eyes....awesome, but what was even bettter was the next photo which showed our husbands getting the same treatment! It was a truly remarkable expeirence. I strongly suggest getting "the works". The staff at Doc Wilkinsons were the friendiest and most helpful we met during our 12 day trip to San Francisco and Napa! The accomodations were very clean and comfortable. Don't miss this one, a great experience ata very reasonable price. Be sure to say hello to Diane at the front desk, she is a sweetheart! Mary Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: 27d4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at Dr. Wilkinson's for a birthday getaway. The office staff was friendly and got us checked in in no time. Just so you know, this place is not luxurious or modern, but the grounds are clean and well kept. The rooms were clean and a good size and the beds/pillows were very comfortable. Room included a coffee maker and a small fridge. The outdoor pool is heated and the indoor hottub is huge, more like a small pool. Great place to stay for an old time resort feeling. Everything was close by, a Cal Mart market was practically next door and has everything you could need. Many restaurants and shops within a short stroll. We did not use the on site spa/mudbath on this trip but have in the past and were well treated. Excellent choice for a relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: judieb
Reviews.Content: We booked a 'bungalow' for a romantic weekend in the infamous wine vallely. When we arrived we were put in a regular room, our bungalow was 'not available'. The room was very noisy because of the floor boards creaking upstairs. We complained and asked to be moved. No other rooms available, so we were told. Not true! We were to move the next day, and they would move our belongings. DID NOT HAPPEN. We had to move our own belongings after waiting over an hour for the room to be readied.
